P1 Always The Bomb:
  # With these codes you won't be a
  # bomb on the screen nor can you
  # kill others by running into them but
  # you count as already dead and you
  # can't use weapons.

  - 8118D8C2 FFFF

Luigi Raceway Shortcut:
  # When you see the hole in the
  # road you must jump on the left
  # side of the mountain and fall in
  # the hole from there. If done correctly
  # Lakitu will put you near the starting
  # line and you'll advance one lap!!!
  - 80287F70 00BF

Choco Mountain Shortcut [See Above Note]:
  - 8028A950 00BF

Wario Stadium Shortcut:
  # About 1/3 through the course you will
  # see a wall that is all crooked.
  # Now just go straight for it and
  # you will go right through the wall.
  # It's a big shortcut.
  - 81286645 FFFF

  # graphics will be gone but your player
  # will still have the same effects as

  # still ram other people and make 'em
  # fly.

Turbo Controls P1:
  # When you get a single shell, single
  # banana or a bomb, you can't drop
  # it or shoot it. You have to
  # either cancel it out with another item
  # or clip someone off with it. You
  # can be holding infinite shells or bombs
  # or bananas if you get them in
  # singles, one after another.
  - 800F6914 0000
  - 800F6915 0000
  - 800F691A 0000

Music Modifier:
  # Thanks to HyperHacker for the quantity digits.
  # The code messes up the sound a
  # bit, but pausing the game fixes it.
  # 00 - No Music 01 - Title
  # 02 - Menu 03 - Raceway 04
  # - Moo Moo Farm 05 - Choco
  # Mountain 06 - Koopa Troopa Beach 07
  # - Banshee Boardwalk 08 - Snow 09
  # - Bowser's Castle 0A - Kalimari Desert
  # 0B - Mario GP Start 0C -
  # Final Lap0D - First Place 0E -
  # Second - Fourth 0F - You Lose
  # 10 - Race Results 11 - Invincibility
  # Star 12 - Rainbow Road 13 -
  # DK's Jungle Parkway 14 - ??? 15
  # - Toad's Turnpike 16 - VS/Battle Start
  # 17 - VS/Battle Results 18 - Retry/Quit
  # 19 - Big Donut/Skyscraper 1A - Trophy
  # Ceremony, Part 1 1B - Trophy Ceremony,
  # Part 2 (You Win) 1C - Credits
  # 1D - Trophy Ceremony, Part 2 (You
  # Lose)
  - 810C34C0 3C04
  - 810C34C2 0001
  - 810C34C4 2484
  - 810C34C6 FF00

Players Don't Tumble:
  # Climbing hills was never easier. This code
  # is very fun. Try it on Royal
  # Raceway and jump off the jump at
  # a steep part of the mountain. Jump
  # right as you hit and you'll go
  # very high. Now I see just why
  # all the tumbling was necessary; the physics
  # of the game are terrible (though very
  # fun in races).
  - 8108F494 03E0
  - 8108F496 0008
  - 8108F498 2400

  # with the original values of course (45).

  - 8002E058 0010

Mirror Mode Flag:
  # Setting this to 1 when you aren't
  # in Mirror Mode flips the objects, but
  # not the polygons (EG you'll still be
  # on the normal track, but trees and
  # signs will be moved). It also flips
  # the path you're supposed to take, which
  # means unless you use levitation and drive-in-air
  # cheats to follow the map in the
  # air, you can't finish.
  - 800DC604 0001

Track Selected (Data Screen):
  # 00~0F Normal tracks 10~13 Battle courses (can
  # see garbage data, don't erase or you
  # could mess up your save!) 14~FF Freezes
  # (with a square in the corner. Interesting...
  # Probably a debug icon like the one
  # in Zelda.)
  - 8018EDF7 000F

Merge Characters:
  # Freaky! Choose a value from 0~7 (corresponding
  # to a character) to put in the
  # code. Start the game and choose someone
  # else. When the race starts, you'll be
  # a mess of polygons with the colour
  # and attributes of the character you chose
  # in the game, but the shape of
  # the one in the code!
  - 810F6BE4 000A

P1 Weight Modifier <b>(TRY ME!!!)</b>:
  # This code actually changes the weight of
  # your character. The default is 42B5 no
  # matter who you choose. (Odd.) Changing weight
  # has some very unusual effects on the
  # game. (Higher values = more weight.) First
  # of all, for some reason you fall
  # faster when you're lighter! Secondly, it greatly
  # affects your traction and speed. Here's
  # a few to try. 47B5 = Moon
  # gravity, turn/stop on a dime, and a
  # top speed of about 2 MPH. :D
  # 40B5 = Lighter than helium! You accelerate
  # to over 100 MPH almost instantly, you
  # fall like an anvil and bounce about
  # 7 times, going higher with each bounce,
  # and you slide around like mad! Steering's
  # hard tho, and <i>forget</i> about stopping. If
  # you're lucky, you'll be able to slam
  # on the brakes, let off the gas,
  # turn sideways, and stop about a mile
  # down the road. :p Hard to get
  # into caves, but super fun! Probably the
  # best code I ever made! So what
  # are you waiting for? TRY IT ALREADY!
  # (BTW, it'll f*ck up the trophy scene
  # and freeze the game, so turn the
  # game off when the scene starts.)
  - 810F6A8C 42B5

P2/COM1 Weight Modifier:
  - 810F7864 0000

P3/COM2 Weight Modifier:
  - 810F863C 0000

P4/COM3 Weight Modifier:
  - 810F9414 0000

  # line.
  - 810F69A4 0000

  # C6 Normal C5 Colours are dull CF
  # Demo Cam!
  - 800F6990 00C6

No Race Start SFX:
  - 803B03CB 0000

Luigi Raceway Has A Tree On The Road (Moves Some Objects ):
  - 8115F9D0 C308

Track Modifier (Not The Same As Other Code):
  # It's hard to explain. This isn't a
  # modifier for which track you race on,
  # it modifies which one from that cup
  # you're on. For example, on Star Cup,
  # 0 = Wario Stadium, 1 = Sherbet
  # land, 2 = Royal Raceway, and 3
  # = Bowser's Castle. 4 and up probably
  # just freeze the game.
  - 8018EE0B 000A

Outer Space Mode:
  # This cheat is very weird and can
  # be glitchy too in some situations. This
  # code gives you barely any gravity. You
  # run off a ledge and you barely
  # go down at all. You can also
  # drive in the air. Pressing "R" Makes
  # you jump up and go a little
  # higher. It is definitely worth a try.
  # i) Slipping on bananas does nothing except
  # trigger the annoying noise your character makes
  # when he is unhappy. ii) Shells mostly
  # send you rocketing downwards. You fall in
  # the water that isn't there and Lakitu
  # tries to put you back on the
  # level and fails to do so. iii)
  # There is no power sliding. iv) The
  # graphics for the levels in V.S. Mode
  # get screwed up. v) If you are
  # flying and you hit someone in the
  # head, you will go flying upwards and
  # never will come down. vi) If you
  # crash into a wall at high speeds,
  # you will start to spin like the
  # way when you get hit by a
  # shell and it will take a while
  # for you to get to the ground
  # depending on how high up you are.
  - 8002E37C 0000
  - 800F6A4F 0000
  - 800F7827 0000
  - 800F85FF 0000
  - 800F93D7 0000

  - 8108D4EA 0000

  - 8108F076 0000

  - 8108EDFA 0000

  - 81031FD0 2400

  # 3FC8 will boost you to >110km/h for
  # a few seconds.
  - 81031FF6 3FC8

Constantly Spinning:
  - 81032018 2400

Can Activate Coordinate Display When Debug Mode Is Off:
  # Parasyte hacked the Coordinate Display code which
  # is 810DC515 0001 and is already on
  # the site. Normally you need to turn
  # Debug Mode on to use it; this
  # removes that requirement.
  - 81001630 2400
  - 81001634 2400

Can Use D-Pad To Advance Laps Even When Debug Mode Is Off:
  - 8128FB28 2400

Debug CPU Display Is Always On, Even When Not In Debug Mode:
  - 81001DD4 2400
  - 81001DD8 2400

Can Activate CPU Display When Debug Mode Is Off:
  # Parasyte hacked the CPU Display code (incorrectly(?)
  # labelled as Sound Display) which is 800DC663
  # 0001 and is already on the site.
  # Normally you need to turn Debug Mode
  # on to use it; this removes that
  # requirement.
  - 81001DC4 1000

Can Start Race Early By Pressing Z Even When Debug Mode Is Off:
  - 81290008 2400

Modify Which Round You Start In The Selected Cup (0-3):
  # You must follow some specific steps to
  # use this code: 1) Start a Mario
  # GP game. 2) At the character selection
  # screen, hold L on controller 1 and
  # choose your character. Don't release L until
  # the cup selection screen appears. 3) Select
  # a cup; you should start in round
  # 1 as normal. If you start in
  # the round you chose and there are
  # several Marios, either you did it wrong
  # or the code doesn't work. 4) Quit
  # the race, select Mario GP again. 5)
  # Select the same character again, and DO
  # NOT hold L. 6) Select your desired
  # cup and you should begin in the
  # round you selected. Once you've finished (or
  # quit) a GP race, you should be
  # able to start another one normally (no
  # having to hold L and quit first).
  # This is still largely untested though. May
  # have problems on emulators because it modifies
  # ASM when you press L. Values 4
  # and up allow you to race on
  # tracks from other cups, but I don't
  # think you can finish the cup. By
  # the way, instead of holding L and
  # starting a game, you can just let
  # the first title screen demo run, then
  # start the game as normal. However, the
  # game will not set up the AI
  # characters properly; it sets them up as
  # if you were Mario. If you select
  # someone else, then the AI character that
  # should be Mario will instead be the
  # character you selected. This doesn't appear to
  # cause any problems though. Razz Tested on
  # a real N64.
  - 810B446C 2400
  - 810B4458 0800
  - 810B445A 00E0
  - 810B445C 3C01
  - 810B445E 8019
  - 81000380 241B
  - 81000382 000A
  - D00F6915 0020
  - 81000382 0000
  - 81000384 0802
  - 81000386 D118
  - 81000388 A03B
  - 8100038A EE0B

Which Time To View On Title Screen When You Press R (Still Says Mario Raceway):
  # FFC8 Luigi Raceway FFD0 Moo Moo Farm
  # FFD8 Koopa Troopa Beach FFE0 Kalimari Desert
  # FFE8 Toad's Turnpike FFF0 Frappe Snowland FFF8
  # Choco Mountain 0000 Mario Raceway 0008 Wario
  # Stadium 0010 Sherbet Land 0018 Royal Raceway
  # 0020 Bowser's Castle 0028 DK's Jungle Parkway
  # 0030 Yoshi Valley 0038 Banshee Boardwalk 0040
  # Rainbow Road These values show the 1st
  # place time. Add 1 for 2nd, 2
  # for 3rd, 3 for 4th, 4 for
  # 5th, or 5 for best lap. Eg:
  # 003A will show the 3rd place time
  # for Banshee Boardwalk.
  - 8109F9B0 2404
  - 8109F9B2 FFC8

Which Position It Says You're In When Paused:
  - 8105C9D0 2419
  - 8105C9D2 0000

Show Top 4 In Yoshi Valley:
  - 8104FDE0 1000

Hide Top 4 In Every Track:
  - 8104FDE0 2400

Which Track To Hide The Top 4 On:
  # 00 - Mario Raceway 01 - Choco
  # Mountain 02 - Bowser Castle 03 -
  # Banshee Boardwalk 04 - Yoshi Valley 05
  # - Frappe Snowland 06 - Koopa Troopa
  # Beach 07 - Royal Raceway 08 -
  # Luigi Raceway 09 - Moo Moo Farm
  # 0A - Toad's Turnpike 0B - Kalimari
  # Desert 0C - Sherbet Land 0D -
  # Rainbow Road 0E - Wario Stadium 0F
  # - Block Fort 10 - Skyscraper 11
  # - Double Deck 12 - DK Jungle
  # Parkway 13 - Big Donut
  - 8004FDC7 0000

Colour 1 Red Value:
  # Note that changing the sky colours may
  # cause graphical glitches (Kalimari Desert, Rainbow Road),
  # reveal nasty graphic errors (DK's Jungle Parkway),
  # or not even work (Choco Mountain, Banshee
  # Boardwalk). Try B0 B0 00 B0 00
  # 00 for a sunset effect.
  - 812B8AD0 00B0

  - 80165F6D 0000

  # certainly impressed!

L1:
  # 00 - &lt;end of word&gt; 20 -
  # &lt;space&gt; 21 - ! 22 - "
  # 23 - # 24 - $ 25
  # - % 26 - & 27 -
  # ' 28 - ( 29 - )
  # 2A - &lt;star&gt; 2B - + 2C
  # - , 2D - - 2E -
  # . 2F - / 30 - 0
  # 31 - 1 32 - 2 33
  # - 3 34 - 4 35 -
  # 5 36 - 6 37 - 7
  # 38 - 8 39 - 9 3A
  # - : 3B - ; 3C -
  # &lt; 3D - = 3E - &gt;
  # 3F - ? 40 - @ 41
  # - A 42 - B 43 -
  # C 44 - D 45 - E
  # 46 - F 47 - G 48
  # - H 49 - I 4A -
  # J 4B - K 4C - L
  # 4D - M 4E - N 4F
  # - O 50 - P 51 -
  # Q 52 - R 53 - S
  # 54 - T 55 - U 56
  # - V 57 - W 58 -
  # X 59 - Y 5A - Z
  # 5B - [ 5C - \ 5D
  # - ] 5E - ^ 5F -
  # _ 60 - `  61 -
  # a 62 - b 63 - c
  # 64 - d 65 - e 66
  # - f 67 - g 68 -
  # h 69 - i 6A - j
  # 6B - k 6C - l 6D
  # - m 6E - n 6F -
  # o 70 - p 71 - q
  # 72 - r 73 - s 74
  # - t 75 - u 76 -
  # v 77 - w 78 - x
  # 79 - y 7A - z
  - 800EFDCC 0000

  - 800EFDCD 0000

  # start boost. The boost lasts until you
  # hit the wall.

  # or almost anything else, you won't tumble
  # but you will pop up.

Lap 1 Time Modifier:
  - 8018CA91 0000
  - 8018CA92 0000
  - 8018CA93 0000

Lap 2 Time Modifier:
  - 8018CA95 0000
  - 8018CA96 0000
  - 8018CA97 0000

Lap 3 Time Modifier:
  - 8018CA99 0000
  - 8018CA9A 0000
  - 8018CA9B 0000

Total Time Modifier:
  - 8018CA79 0000
  - 8018CA7A 0000
  - 8018CA7B 0000

1st Place:
  # <p>The first line of code I will
  # refer to as time 1, the second
  # Time 2, and the third Driver/Time 3.
  # Time one can go up to a
  # Max. of FF which equals 00'02"55. Time
  # two (starting at 00) goes up one
  # for every time Time 1 reaches FF.
  # If Time 1 equals 00 and Time
  # 2 equals 01, the time would be
  # 00'02"56. In the Driver/Time 3 line the
  # "Y" digit controls the name of the
  # Driver written next to the time. The
  # Time 3 part, "X," of the third
  # line (starting at 0) goes up by
  # 1 everytime both Time 1 and Time
  # 2 equal FF. The highest time possible
  # is 99'59"99 (Time 1=BF Time 2=27 Time3=9)
  # anything higher causes the record to read
  # --'--"--. The Driver Modifier Digits are listed
  # below:</p> 0 - Mario 1 - Luigi
  # 2 - Yoshi 3 - Toad 4
  # - D.K. 5 - Wario 6 -
  # Peach 7 - Bowser 8 - ----
  # 9 - 50cc A - 100cc B
  # - 150cc C - Extra D -
  # 50cc E - 100cc F - 150cc
  - 8018EB90 00FF
  - 8018EB91 00FF
  - 8018EB92 0000

2nd Place:
  - 8018EB93 0000
  - 8018EB94 0000
  - 8018EB95 0000

3rd Place:
  - 8018EB96 0000
  - 8018EB97 0000
  - 8018EB98 0000

4th Place:
  - 8018EB99 0000
  - 8018EB9A 0000
  - 8018EB9B 0000

5th Place:
  - 8018EB9C 0000
  - 8018EB9D 0000
  - 8018EB9E 0000

Best Lap:
  - 8018EB9F 0000
  - 8018EBA0 0000
  - 8018EBA1 0000

1st Place:
  - 8018EBA8 0000
  - 8018EBA9 0000
  - 8018EBAA 0000

2nd Place:
  - 8018EBAB 0000
  - 8018EBAC 0000
  - 8018EBAD 0000

3rd Place:
  - 8018EBAE 0000

Maximum Speed Modifier P1:
  # Tired of not being able to go
  # more than 60 or 80 normally? Just
  # up this value a bit. hehehehe This
  # actually seems to effect all human players.
  # When I did versus all 4 players
  # could go fast, but when I did
  # Grand Prix on the human player(s) could
  # go fast. Some Defaults: 439B 0000 -
  # Time Trials 4391 0000 - 50CC 43A0
  # 0000 - 150CC
  - 810F6BA4 439B
  - 810F6BA6 439B

Maximum Speed Modifier P2:
  - 810F797C 0000
  - 810F797E 0000

P3/COM 2 Top Speed:
  # The default top speed for a Human
  # is 43900000 on 50cc. I'm not sure
  # about the other modes, and CPU players
  # seem to vary. Here's a few good
  # ones to try:  43CD0000 Approx. 110
  # KM/h (any higher and your brakes don't
  # work good)  40010000 Too slow to
  # notice  43030000 Putt putt  When
  # you use a Mushroom, you are propelled
  # to just beyond your maximum speed. So
  # don't set it too high or using
  # a Mushroom might freeze the game.[/
  - 810F8754 0000
  - 810F8756 0000

P4/COM 3 Top Speed:
  - 810F952C 0000
  - 810F952E 0000

  - 810FA304 0000
  - 810FA306 0000

Floating Jump:

Super Acceleration From A Standing Start:
  # When stopped, Press A To To Take
  # Off.
  - 810E2ED0 4500

  - 81031F80 2400
  - 81031FD0 1000
  - 81031EC4 1000

  - 81031074 449B
  - 81031076 9000

  - 81061692 0000

  - 81031696 3000

  - 81031134 449B
  - 81031136 3000

Super Acceleration/Speed Most Of The Time:
  # This is lkike a data block of
  # acceleration types. E2ED0 is from a stopped
  # position, I think E2EF4 is from moving
  # if you let off A then hit
  # it again, etc. it's strange an dI
  # don't have time to explore it.
  - 50002504 0000
  - 810E2ED0 4500

# Of Laps Counted When Crossing Finish Line:
  - 81009562 0000

Boosts Don't Work (Seems To Mess Up Gravity Too):
  - 810225E8 2400

Astro Mode:
  # It's like racing in space; the characters
  # will randomly start flying away and there's
  # hardly any gravity. It's hard to get
  # moving again on hills though - and
  # DON'T crash.
  - 8002E37C 0000

Endless Race:
  - 81009564 2400

Messed Up Laps:
  - 81009564 AC48

Everyone Finishes As Soon As They Cross The Starting Line:
  - 81009564 AC4C

Cheat Laps (Going Across The Finish Line The Wrong Way Doesn't Subtract Laps. Thus You Can Just Drive Back And Forth  Across It And Win!):
  - 810096B0 2400

Item Control:
  # 01 Get A Random Item  02
  # Same as 01  03 Same as
  # 01 but doesn't show the item
  # 04 Same as 03  05 Same
  # as 03  06 Instant Random Item,
  # Hitting An Item Box Gives You The
  # Same Item  07 Item Blinks
  # 08 No Effect?  09 Hide Window
  #  0A Hide Window (can still see
  # item as it scrolls away)  0B
  # Same as 0A  0C Hide Window
  # Until Used  0D Same as 08
  #  0E Same as 08  32
  # Item Blinks A Lot
  - 80165F5F 0001

COM 5 Top Speed:
  - 810FB0DC 0000
  - 810FB0DE 0000

COM 7 Top Speed:
  # The default top speed for a Human
  # is 43900000 on 50cc. I'm not sure
  # about the other modes, and CPU players
  # seem to vary. Here's a few good
  # ones to try:  43CD0000 Approx. 110
  # KM/h (any higher and your brakes don't
  # work good)  40010000 Too slow to
  # notice  43030000 Putt putt  When
  # you use a Mushroom, you are propelled
  # to just beyond your maximum speed. So
  # don't set it too high or using
  # a Mushroom might freeze the game.
  - 810FCC8C 0000
  - 810FCC8E 0000

COM 7 Weight:
  # The normal weight for everyone is 45B50000,
  # strangely enough. Plus, lower values make you
  # fall slower! If you put it way
  # up high you'll barely be able to
  # move but your speedometer will max out!
  # This is a fun code!
  - 810FCB74 0000
  - 810FCB76 0000

P1 Size (Normally 3F800000 - It Seems That Setting It To 30000000 Affects Your Driving, Somehow):
  - 810F6BB4 0000
  - 810F6BB6 0000

Amount Added To Lap Counter When Passing Finish Line In Wrong Direction (Normally -1 (FFFF)):
  # With this code, you can set the
  # value to 0001 to advance a lap
  # even if going the wrong way! Then
  # just drive back and forth over the
  # line to win! Or, set it to
  # 0003 and drive across it backward once
  # to win!
  - 810096AA 0001

P1 Slight Tilt Modifier? (Normally C230):
  - 810F6B74 0000

P1 Gravity Modifier? (Normally 3F80 - Lower Values Make You Fall Faster!):
  - 810F273C 0000

  - 810F69A4 0000
  - 810F69A6 0000

  - 810F69AA 0000

Your Z Coordinates:
  - 810F69AC 0000
  - 810F69AE 0000

  - 811646FE 0000

  - 81164706 0000

# Of Balloons @ Start Of Battle (Norm 0002):
  # Balloons don't work right when there are
  # more than 3, and only 3 show.
  # Sometimes they'll even fly off someone else,
  # but it doesn't count against them. Just
  # keep track yourself!
  - 8106B86E 0000

Race Never Starts:
  - 810723FC 2400

L Button Doesn't Change Music Level (ASM version):
  - 8028FA1C 0000

Item Select:
  # Here's how it works. When the race
  # starts, race normally until you get an
  # item and it stops flashing. Then press
  # C Left and C Right together (this
  # can be done while paused). Now, you
  # won't lose your item when you use
  # it, and the item window will display
  # even when empty. Press L to cycle
  # through the items. Use whatever you want
  # as much as you want! When the
  # race ends, press L+R, or the item
  # window will act funny in the next
  # race. BTW, the last line sets the
  # music level, so the code doesn't constantly
  # change it on you. Put in a
  # value there to use whatever level you
  # want. Also since this uses the code
  # for changing music level, it won't work
  # while paused, but another player can change
  # the item for you (which could be
  # good or bad, hehe). Tip: Use this
  # with my Infinite Random Items code. It'll
  # give you an item at the start
  # of the race, so you don't have
  # to wait before turning the code on.
  # Oh, and one other thing. When using
  # the Super Mushroom, after it runs out
  # you won't have an item but it'll
  # still show the shroom. Just stick to
  # normal shrooms, you have infinite anyway. BTW
  # thanks to Parasyte and IceMario for help
  # with the ASM. :)
  - 8128FA04 0800
  - 8128FA06 00C7
  - 8128FA08 0000
  - 8100031C 27BD
  - 8100031E FFF0
  - 81000320 AFA1
  - 81000324 AFA2
  - 81000326 0004
  - 81000328 3C01
  - 8100032A 8016
  - 8100032C 8022
  - 8100032E 5F5D
  - 81000330 2442
  - 81000332 0001
  - 81000334 3042
  - 81000336 000F
  - 81000338 A022
  - 8100033A 5F5D
  - 8100033C A022
  - 8100033E 5F8A
  - 81000340 8FA2
  - 81000342 0004
  - 81000344 8FA1
  - 81000348 A60D
  - 8100034A 0006
  - 8100034C 962E
  - 81000350 080A
  - 81000352 3E83
  - 81000354 27BD
  - 81000356 0010
  - D00F6915 0003
  - 8107AD84 2400
  - D00F6915 0003
  - 8107B3F8 2400
  - D00F6915 0030
  - 8107AD84 A620
  - D00F6915 0030
  - 8107B3F8 950E
  - 800DC5A9 0004

Infinite Random Items P1:
  - D0165F5F 0000
  - 80165F5F 0001

Player 1 Keeps Turning Right:
  # With some characters, you can fight it
  # by turning hard to the left. Makes
  # you dizzy pretty fast, though.
  - 810096C0 080F
  - 810096C2 C000
  - 810096C4 2400
  - 813F0000 3C01
  - 813F0002 800F
  - 813F0004 803B
  - 813F0006 69BE
  - 813F0008 277B
  - 813F000A 0001
  - 813F000C A03B
  - 813F000E 69BE
  - 813F0010 3C0E
  - 813F0012 800E
  - 813F0014 3C01
  - 813F0016 8016
  - 813F0018 0800
  - 813F001A 25B2

Player 1 Spazzes Out!:
  # The character spins around a lot and
  # the game eventually crashes. If you can
  # get toward a wall, the screen will
  # start to spin around, which is really
  # neat.
  - 810096C0 080F
  - 810096C2 C000
  - 810096C4 2400
  - 813F0000 3C01
  - 813F0002 800F
  - 813F0004 803B
  - 813F0006 6BC0
  - 813F0008 277B
  - 813F000A 0001
  - 813F000C A03B
  - 813F000E 6BC0
  - 813F0010 3C0E
  - 813F0012 800E
  - 813F0014 3C01
  - 813F0016 8016
  - 813F0018 0800
  - 813F001A 25B2

Byte Copy Code:
  # This code will continually copy one byte
  # from address 80ssssss, add nnnn to it
  # (you can use 0 or negative numbers),
  # and write it to 80dddddd during the
  # race. It will only be active when
  # you're actually driving, not during the start/end/menus/etc.
  # It doesn't work in battle mode (nothing
  # happens). Also note that due to N64's
  # crappy stupid signed addition, there are restrictions
  # on the addresses. If you use an
  # address in the format 80xxYxxx where Y
  # is greater than 7, it won't work
  # right. One way that you could get
  # around this, though I haven't tested it,
  # is to subtract 18000 from the address
  # (ex: 80339ABC -> 80321ABC). An example usage
  # of this would be to replace ssssss
  # with 0F6990, dddddd with 0F7768, and nnnn
  # with 0000. Now, every time player 1
  # wipes out, gets a boost, etc, so
  # does player 2!
  - 810096C0 080F
  - 810096C2 C000
  - 810096C4 2400
  - 813F0000 3C01
  - 813F0002 8000
  - 813F0004 803B
  - 813F0006 0000
  - 813F0008 3C01
  - 813F000A 80DD
  - 813F000C 277B
  - 813F000E 0000
  - 813F0010 A03B
  - 813F0012 DDDD
  - 813F0014 3C01
  - 813F0016 8016
  - 813F0018 0800
  - 813F001A 25B2
  - 813F001C 3C0E
  - 813F001E 800E

Points Won For 1st Place:
  # Only the lowest digit will be shown.
  # You can't change the amount for 5th-8th
  # place. If you get more than 255,
  # it goes back to 0, so be
  # careful!
  - 800F0B18 00BE

Points Won For 2nd Place:
  - 800F0B19 0000

Points Won For 3rd Place:
  - 800F0B1A 0000

Points Won For 4th Place:
  - 800F0B1B 0000

Nobody Can Move! (Change Value To 9482 To Disable):
  - 80028E84 0000

Position Display Doesn't Update:
  - 8104E850 2400

Randomly Scaled Track Height:
  # When you load a track, randomly set
  # the vertical scale on the track track
  # to +/- 5.0 times the regular height.
  # This code queries the game's random number
  # generator to randomly set the scale value
  # from a list of possible values a
  # few times a second. Whenever you load
  # a track, the scale value will be
  # random. Sometimes a track will load with
  # a random scale value that makes it
  # unplayable and you will have to reset.
  - D02BA290 0001
  - 810DC608 C0A0
  - D02BA290 0002
  - 810DC608 C080
  - D02BA290 0003
  - 810DC608 C060
  - D02BA290 0004
  - 810DC608 C040
  - D02BA290 0005
  - 810DC608 C020
  - D02BA290 0006
  - 810DC608 C000
  - D02BA290 0007
  - 810DC608 BFC0
  - D02BA290 0008
  - 810DC608 BF80
  - D02BA290 0009
  - 810DC608 BF00
  - D02BA290 0010
  - 810DC608 0000
  - D02BA290 0011
  - 810DC608 3F00
  - D02BA290 0012
  - 810DC608 3F80
  - D02BA290 0013
  - 810DC608 3FC0
  - D02BA290 0014
  - 810DC608 4000
  - D02BA290 0015
  - 810DC608 4020
  - D02BA290 0016
  - 810DC608 4040
  - D02BA290 0017
  - 810DC608 4060
  - D02BA290 0018
  - 810DC608 4080
  - D02BA290 0019
  - 810DC608 40A0

Random Mushroom Boosts:
  # This code will randomly cause characters to
  # mushroom boost about once every 10 seconds.
  #  Use for a crazy fun race.
  - D02BA290 0001
  - 800F699E 0002
  - D02BA290 0002
  - 800F7776 0002
  - D02BA290 0003
  - 800F854E 0002
  - D02BA290 0004
  - 800F9326 0002
  - D02BA290 0005
  - 800FA0FE 0002
  - D02BA290 0006
  - 800FAED6 0002
  - D02BA290 0007
  - 800FBCAE 0002
  - D02BA290 0008
  - 800FCA86 0002

Always Mushroom Boosting:
  # All players/CPUs always will be mushroom boosting.
  - D00F6A4E 0000
  - 800F699E 0002
  - D00F7826 0000
  - 800F7776 0002
  - D00F85FE 0000
  - 800F854E 0002
  - D00F93D6 0000
  - 800F9326 0002
  - D00FA1AE 0000
  - 800FA0FE 0002
  - D00FAF86 0000
  - 800FAED6 0002
  - D00FBD5E 0000
  - 800FBCAE 0002
  - D00FCB36 0000
  - 800FCA86 0002

2P VS mode P1 1st place:
  # ?? is an 8 bit integer that
  # counts how many times the player has
  # gotten this place in a VS match.
  - 8000031C 0000

2P VS mode P2 1st place:
  - 8000031D 0000

3P VS mode P1 1st place:
  - 8000031E 0000

3P VS mode P1 2nd place:
  - 8000031F 0000

  - 80000320 0000

  - 80000321 0000

  - 80000322 0000

  - 80000323 0000

  - 80000324 0000

3P VS mode P3 2nd place:
  - 80000325 0000

3P VS mode P3 3rd place:
  - 80000326 0000

  - 80000327 0000

4P VS mode P1 2nd place:
  - 80000328 0000

4P VS mode P1 3rd place:
  - 80000329 0000

  - 8000032A 0000

4P VS mode P2 2nd place:
  - 8000032B 0000

4P VS mode P2 3rd place:
  - 8000032C 0000

4P VS mode P3 1st place:
  - 8000032D 0000

4P VS mode P3 2nd place:
  - 8000032E 0000

4P VS mode P3 3rd place:
  - 8000032F 0000

4P VS mode P4 1st place:
  - 80000330 0000

4P VS mode P4 2nd place:
  - 80000331 0000

4P VS mode P4 3rd place:
  - 80000332 0000

2P battle mode P1 ranking:
  # ?? is an 8 bit integer that
  # counts how many times the player has
  # won a battle match.
  - 80000333 0000

2P battle mode P2 ranking:
  - 80000334 0000

3P battle mode P1 ranking:
  - 80000335 0000

3P battle mode P2 ranking:
  - 80000336 0000

3P battle mode P3 ranking:
  - 80000337 0000

4P battle mode P1 ranking:
  - 80000338 0000

4P battle mode P2 ranking:
  - 80000339 0000

4P battle mode P3 ranking:
  - 8000033A 0000

4P battle mode P4 ranking:
  - 8000033B 0000

Mushroom Cup - Course 1:
  # Now you can customize the 4 courses
  # for each GP cup.  Now you
  # can play Rainbow road 4 times in
  # a row if you want. ?? =
  #  00 - Mario Raceway 01 -
  # Choco Mountain 02 - Bowser's Castle 03
  # - Banshee Boardwalk 04 - Yoshi Valley
  # 05 - Frappe Snowland 06 - Koopa
  # Troopa Beach  07 - Royal Raceway
  # 08 - Luigi Raceway 09 - Moo
  # Moo Farm 0A - Toad's Turnpike 0B
  # - Kalamari Desert 0C - Sherbert Land
  # 0D - Rainbow Road 0E - Wario
  # Stadium 0F - Block Fort 10 -
  # Skyscraper 11 - Double Deck 12 -
  # DK's Jungle Parkway 13 - Big Donut
  - 800F2BB5 0000

Mushroom Cup - Course 2:
  - 800F2BB7 0000

Mushroom Cup - Course 3:
  - 800F2BB9 0000

Mushroom Cup - Course 4:
  - 800F2BBB 0000

Flower Cup - Course 1:
  - 800F2BBD 0000

Flower Cup - Course 2:
  - 800F2BBF 0000

Flower Cup - Course 3:
  - 800F2BC1 0000

Flower Cup - Course 4:
  - 800F2BC3 0000

Star Cup - Course 1:
  - 800F2BC5 0000

Star Cup - Course 2:
  - 800F2BC7 0000

Star Cup - Course 3:
  - 800F2BC9 0000

Star Cup - Course 4:
  - 800F2BCB 0000

Special Cup - Course 1:
  - 800F2BCD 0000

Special Cup - Course 2:
  - 800F2BCF 0000

Special Cup - Course 3:
  - 800F2BD1 0000

Special Cup - Course 4:
  - 800F2BD3 0000

CPU racers endlessly use items:
  # This is the opposite of Parasyte's "CPU
  # Racers Never Use Items" code.  CPUs
  # always spawn items, and turn the track
  # into a banana and fake item box
  # filled mess.
  - 8101ACE0 2400
  - 8101ACF0 2400
  - 8101AD08 2400
  - 8101AD20 2400

Always get item ??:
  # This code preempts the game's random item
  # generation so that you always get item
  # ??= 00: Nothing 01: Single Banana 02:
  # Multi Bananas 03: Single Green Shell 04:
  # Triple Green Shell 05: Single Red Shell
  # 06: Triple Red Shell 07: Blue Shell
  # 08: Lightning Bolt 09: Fake Item Box
  # 0A: Star 0B: Ghost 0C: Single Mushroom
  # 0D: Two Mushrooms 0E: Three Mushrooms 0F:
  # Super Mushroom
  - 8107AF34 2402
  - 8107AF36 0000

Disable Music:
  # This code will disable nearly all the
  # music in the game with the exception
  # of the lightning and ghost item jingles,
  # and some star music in multiplayer.
  # It works mostly by setting the music
  # volume to zero, but some other songs
  # had to be manually squashed.  Credit
  # to HyperHacker for the disable starting line
  # music code.
  - 811930D0 0000
  - 811930D2 0000
  - 811930D4 0000
  - 811930D6 0000
  - 803B03CB 0000
  - 803B03CE 0000
  - 803B0410 0000
  - 813B03CC 0000
  - 803B03D3 0000

CPUs always use item ????:
  # ???? =  0001 = Single Banana
  # 0004 = Green shell 0007 = Red
  # Shell 000A  = Multibanana (kind of
  # glitchy) 000D = Fake item box 0016
  # = Lightning 0019 = Star 001B =
  # Ghost 001D = Single Mushroom 001E =
  # Some other mushroom (double mushroom?) 001F =
  # Some other mushroom (triple mushroom?) 0020 =
  # Some other mushroom (golden mushroom?) 0021 =
  # Some other mushroom (???) 0022 = Single
  # banana thrown forward
  - 8101ABD0 2402
  - 8101ABD2 0000

CPUs can fire green shells:
  - 8101AB9C 2402
  - 8101AB9E 0004

Press R to freeze Koopa Troopa Beach water level and moving textures (1P mode only):
  - 810015B4 0C0A
  - D00F6915 0010
  - 810015B4 2400

Game is paused:
  - D00EA16C 0001

Game is not paused:
  - D00EA16C 0000

Who pressed pause?:
  # ?? = 00 not paused 01 Player
  # 1 pressed pause 02 Player 2 pressed
  # pause 03 Player 3 pressed pause 04
  # Player 4 pressed pause
  - D00DC5FD 0000

In menu?:
  - D018EDFC 0000

In a course (not in a menu)?:
  - D018EDFC 0001

Hide balloon graphics in battle mode:
  - 8106B808 2400
  - 8106B82C 2400
  - 8106B850 2400

Music Modifier 2:
  # This code is fixes the sound glitches
  # of Parasyte's code but only works on
  # tracks (not menus).  Thanks to Rena/HyperHacker's
  # notes for showing the ram location of
  # the table this code modifies. 00 -
  # No Music 01 - Title 02 -
  # Menu 03 - Raceway 04 - Moo
  # Moo Farm 05 - Choco Mountain 06
  # - Koopa Troopa Beach 07 - Banshee
  # Boardwalk 08 - Snow 09 - Bowser's
  # Castle 0A - Kalimari Desert 0B -
  # Mario GP Start 0C - Final Lap0D
  # - First Place 0E - Second -
  # Fourth 0F - You Lose 10 -
  # Race Results 11 - Invincibility Star 12
  # - Rainbow Road 13 - DK's Jungle
  # Parkway 14 - ??? 15 - Toad's
  # Turnpike 16 - VS/Battle Start 17 -
  # VS/Battle Results 18 - Retry/Quit 19 -
  # Big Donut/Skyscraper 1A - Trophy Ceremony, Part
  # 1 1B - Trophy Ceremony, Part 2
  # (You Win) 1C - Credits 1D -
  # Trophy Ceremony, Part 2 (You Lose)
  - 50000C10 0000

Totally Trippy LSD Graphics:
  - 8115014C 5200

Lots of spinning signs on Mario Raceway:
  # This code transforms all the trees and
  # piranha plants on Mario's Raceway all into
  # the giant spinning signs.  Will glitch
  # out or crash other courses so probably
  # only load Mario's Raceway.  Thanks to
  # queueRAM for figuring out the simple item
  # array from who's notes made this code
  # possible.
  - 50003070 0000
  - 8015F9B9 0017

Disable showing Mario Raceway time on title screen (if you press R):
  - 81094BD8 2400

Disable Pipe in Mario's Raceway:
  - 812911C4 03E0
  - 812911C6 0008
  - 812911C8 2400

Disable HUD in race mode and the minimap in battle mode:
  # In 1P mode, this will disable the
  # entire HUD along with items.  VS
  # mode will show items.  In battle
  # mode, it disables the minimap.
  - 81059D08 2400

Automatic Items:
  # This code queries the game's random number
  # generator to give you items without the
  # need to hit the item boxes.
  - D02BA290 0016
  - 8016611F 0002
  - D02BA290 0086
  - 8016611F 0002
  - D02BA290 0017
  - 80165F5F 0002
  - D02BA290 0087
  - 80165F5F 0002
  - D02BA290 0026
  - 801661FF 0002
  - D02BA290 0096
  - 801661FF 0002
  - D02BA290 0027
  - 8016603F 0002
  - D02BA290 0097
  - 8016603F 0002
  - D02BA290 0036
  - 801662DF 0002
  - D02BA290 00A6
  - 801662DF 0002
  - D02BA290 0046
  - 801663BF 0002
  - D02BA290 00B6
  - 801663BF 0002
